originalTitle: Venezuela frees 104 political prisoners, rights group says
title: Happy News! Friends Go Home to Families!
content:
Hello, amazing friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you super exciting news from far, far away. We are going to talk about a place called Venezuela. It's a country, just like our country, but very far across the ocean!

Happy News from Far Away!

Guess what? Something wonderful just happened in Venezuela. Many people who were in jail are now going home! Yes, you heard that right – they are going back to their families! Imagine being away from your mom, dad, brothers, and sisters for a long time. It can make you feel very sad, right? Well, today, 104 people are going to get big hugs from their loved ones! This is very happy news, and it makes many people smile. We love seeing families together.

What is a "Prisoner"?

You might be wondering, "What is a prisoner?" A prisoner is someone who is kept in a special building, like a big house with strong walls. They are not allowed to leave. Sometimes people go to jail because they did something wrong, like taking someone's toy without asking, but much bigger things. But sometimes, people go to jail for other reasons.

What is a "Political Prisoner"?

The people we are talking about today are called "political prisoners." This means they were in jail not because they stole something or hurt anyone. They were in jail because they had certain ideas. Maybe they said things the government didn't like. Or maybe they wanted to help change things in their country. It's like when you have a good idea in class, and you want to share it. These people had big ideas about their country. And sometimes, for having those ideas, they were put in jail. But now, they are free! **Did you know?** Our voices are very important! It's good to share our ideas and talk about what we believe in, in a kind way.

Where is Venezuela?

Venezuela is a country in South America. It's very far from us! If you look at a big map of the world, you would see Africa on one side, and then across a huge ocean, you would see South America. Venezuela is a beautiful country with mountains, beaches, and even a very tall waterfall called Angel Falls! Imagine water falling from very, very high up! **Did you know?** Angel Falls in Venezuela is the tallest waterfall in the world! It's so tall, the water turns into mist before it even reaches the bottom!

Hugs for Everyone!

These 104 people have been waiting for a long time to go home. Their families have been waiting too! Can you imagine the big hugs and happy tears? It's a time for celebration. They can now sit at their dinner tables with their families, play with their children, and tell stories. Freedom means being able to do these simple, wonderful things.

Meeting Two Special Friends

Among the people who are going home, there are two special people we know about. One is a **human rights lawyer**. A lawyer is someone who helps people understand rules and laws. A "human rights lawyer" is a special kind of lawyer. They help make sure everyone is treated fairly and kindly. They fight for people's rights, like the right to be free and safe. The other special person is a **communications student**. A student is someone who goes to school to learn. This student was learning how to share stories and ideas with people, like how to write for a newspaper or talk on the radio. Imagine them using their smart brains to help people and share important messages now that they are free!

What are Human Rights?

"Human rights" sounds like a big word, right? But it's simple! Human rights are like rules that say every person in the world should be treated with respect and kindness. Everyone should be safe, have enough food, go to school, and be free to say what they think (in a good way!). These are very important ideas. **Did you know?** The "human rights group" that shared this happy news is called Foro Penal. They are like superheroes who help people who are in trouble for their ideas.

Why is This Important?

When people are freed, it shows that good things can happen. It shows that leaders can listen and make changes. It gives hope to many other families who are waiting for their loved ones to come home. It reminds us that everyone deserves to be free and happy. It reminds us to be kind to each other and to respect everyone's ideas, even if they are different from ours. **Did you know?** In Venezuela, just like in many countries in Africa, people love to sing and dance! Music can bring people together and help them share their feelings.

A Bright Future

We hope that these 104 people and their families will have a wonderful, happy life together. We hope they can now live freely, share their ideas, and help build a better Venezuela. This news reminds us that even when things are tough, there is always hope for a brighter tomorrow. Let's all wish them well!
summary: Many people who were in jail in Venezuela are now free and going home to their families, bringing joy and hope.
whyMatters: This matters because it means many families will be very happy to be together again, and it shows that even when people have different ideas, kindness and freedom can win.
